column4: my laptop sits idle and the system monitor says that both of my CPUs are ~50%
how do you tell what's sucking up most of my clock cycles?
system monitor, or in a text console, try "top"
in the processes tab the most that it says is 7% and it's nautilus
no, X is a nice lean mean machine.. problem is that 9.04 has some borked up intel GPU driverss
are they going to get those "borked" Intel drivers fixed shortly?
Its a work in progress afaik.. I resolved it myself with switching to a 2.6.30 kernel (you are at 2.6.28 atm)
i followed Intel Performance tutorial in the forums and got Compiz working again
got some rc kernel or something
Barridus: but not that much, thats not normal
alright, shall I roll everything back? I have proposed repos selected...
I'm trying to find the page again that I applied
duh, right under my face.. you already gave me the URL! :) http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1130582&highlight=Intel
dunno which of the 4 solutions you tried, but I tried the one with kernel 2.6.30 and it works like a charm for me.. NO GUARANTEES THOUGH!
yeah that's the one that I tried and upgraded to the .30rc kernel that got Compiz working again but that's also when my lappy began to run hot
